detaileddescription.para: Const variable holding pointers to RTE call functions.

Function validating if slot value is in range
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint8
SlotIndex - 0..1 (i.e. A,B) slots are allowed only.
boolean - True if within range.
Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
N/A Activity Diagram WCZ_SlotIndexValidation
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_SlotIndexValidation
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Design decision: helper function for value validation. Function validating if slot value is in range Please find detail information in the declaration.
Function calculating one of three possible WCZ ranges.

Determine the range, basing on the difference between calculated (estimated) and received WCZ. Defined ranges are: 0..340 (1) 341..10540 (2) or >10540 (3).
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_328} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_346} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_347}
uint8
u32WczIn - recently received WCZ rolling code in FZV telegram. [in] uint8 u32WczCalc - internally calculated / estimated WCZ value.
uint8 - 1..3 - one of these ranges is determined Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
The function is called from UHF_CyclicHandle, when WCZ calculation is performed, the result comparison performed in this function causes either confirmation of validity and activating output signals via ButtonCodeReport or discarding telegram and incrementing error counter. Activity Diagram WCZ_CalculateRange
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_CalculateRange
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements and Design Decision:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_346.
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_347

Function calculating one of three possible WCZ ranges.

Key status validation.

Status of the key, stored in NV have allowable values (0..5).
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_427} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_412} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_467} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_478}

boolean - returns true if passed value is within correct range.
Globals
sNvmWcz sStatus.u8Backup - read value. Input->Output-Correlation
In use during error handling by NVM read to determine status of specific key (index), then Plausibility DTC is called afterwards with prepass/prefailed status. Alternative use case - UHF_CyclicHandle checks through WCZ_CheckKeyActive func if key is disabled or not before processing of incoming UHF telegram. Activity Diagram WCZ_KeyStatusValidation

Testcase shall check if function returns true for correct value range.

On each call of the function alternative NV slot is set up (A->B->A->B... etc), assuming same key is in use, which is then used to store current WCZ/WCZstatus.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint32 valueA, const uint32 valueB, const uint32 valueC, uint32 *valueOut)
memberdef.name: WCZ_CheckConsistency

detaileddescription.para: Function comparing 3 copies of rolling code counter data.

Compares 3 copies of WCZ and determines if at least 2 are the same. If so, the value is transferred to output buffer, otherwise 0.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_117}
uint32
valueA, valueB, valueC - 3 copies of WCZ to compare and determine output value. [out] uint32 *valueOut - returns value of at least 2 same copies or 0.
boolean - true if at least 2 copies are same.
Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
Called during read or verification of NVM WCZ triple storage to determine if value is corrupted or is fine to use. Activity Diagram WCZ_CheckConsistency
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_CheckConsistency
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirement:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_117
Function comparing 3 copies of rolling code counter data.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Function for handling of DEM event interface.

Function is handling DEM event interface for all theoretically configurable key indices regarding "Remote Key Plausibility" fault. If all of NVM stored 3 copies of WCZ, when read back, show different values, fault is reported.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint8
KeyIndex - key index with valid range 1..8 [in] Dem_EventStatusType status - if at least 2 copies are not the same, DTC = DEM_EVENT_STATUS_PREFAILED, otherwise = DEM_EVENT_STATUS_PREPASSED
void Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
Called during Read/Verify/Write process of NVM WCZ storage, when retrieved value is corrupted or when process is successful. One DTC per key index is defined but due to data organization, all DTCs are tested together either with prepassed or prefailed status. Activity Diagram WCZ_PlausibleDTC
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_PlausibleDTC
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3263.
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3268.
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3272.
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3276.
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3280.
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3284.
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3288.
SWR_ICAS1_GW_3292.
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_118,
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_132.
Function for handling of DEM event interface.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Function requests synchronization of last used key to NVM.

Function requests immediate synchronization (to NVM) of last used key i.e. of recently received WCZ in first frame (within last FZV burst), if one of following conditions is met: KL15 is active and authorized with last KeyFob OR Entry via Kessy with Last Keyfob is succesfull.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_479} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_482}
void
void Globals
sNvmWcz sStatus.u8Backup - R access to determine key index status. sNvmWc. sStatus.u8LastKeyIndex - R access to determine last key index status. Input->Output-Correlation
There are 2 external scenarios, which force last used key re-synchronization if status is not OK due to WCZ received in range 2 or 3. The key transmitted FFB telegrams afterwards are processed again. NVM synchronization of WCZ value/status is triggered. Activity Diagram WCZ_Synchronization
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_Synchronization
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_479.
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_482.
Function requests synchronization of last used key to NVM.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Function setting up specified key status in NVM.

Status for specified key is copied to buffer and flags are set to write it to NVM and read back to verify.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_520}
uint8
KeyIndex - key index with valid range 1..8. . [in] uint8 status - value to be stored in internal status buffer and written to NVM.
void Globals
sNvmWcz sValue.u32Backup - read and write value. sNvmWcz sValue.u8Write - write value. sNvmWcz sValue.u8Read - write value. Input->Output-Correlation
Status change triggering synchronization with NVM - 3 call scenarios possible:
evFFBDataExchange (learning procedure),
UHF_CyclicHandle (after First Telegram range determined),
WCZ_Synchronization (one of sync conditions fulfilled). As a result, NVM synch W/V procedure of specific key status is requested. Activity Diagram WCZ_SetStatus
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_SetStatus
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_520.
Function setting up specified key status in NVM.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Status of all keys is transferred from NVM to internal buffers.

In "real" use after wake up or reset, otherwise no effect. The simplified flow is: clear all R/W flags set statuses and validity to invalid for all keys, clear last key check status of NVM block --- if block is OK, read NV data to internal buffer (status[], valid[], last key) --- if block is corrupted, rewrite block with values in internal buffers --- if unknown status of NV or unknown status of the key read, then set prefail Key Plausibility DTCs --- if block is busy, skip checks for now
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
void
void Globals
sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Read - R/W access, trigger for read sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Write - W access, unconditional clear sNvmWcz sFlags.bValid - R/W access, flag set when read process is successful sNvmWcz sStatus.u8Backup - W access, status byte for each WCZ key, working copy mirrored in NVM status bytes sNvmWcz sStatus.sEntry.nvm_id - NV stack block identifier, referenced as parameter to function call sNvmWcz sStatus.pim_ptr->rb_fdh_Retry - R/W access, restored from NVM, reinit in case of corrupted data. sNvmWcz sStatus.u8LastKeyIndex -R/W access, restored from NVM, reinit in case of corrupted data.
Input->Output-Correlation
Input: NVM block; NVM block status check via NvM_GetErrorStatus(), trigger for read flag, see Globals
Called from WCZ_CyclicHandle periodically (every 10ms). However read from NVM operation is triggered (flag DATA_NVM_STATUS_RD set) only during system wake up initialization WCZ_Initialization. Output: output data is available in Globals,
In case of detected corrupted NVM block or invalid state of NVM block, DTCs for all keys (8) "WCZ plausible" is tested as prefail. Activity Diagram WCZ_StatusReadFromNvm
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_StatusReadFromNvm
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_118.
Status of all keys is transferred from NVM to internal buffers.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Status of all keys is transferred to NVM from internal buffers.

Write in case of status change of any key. The simplified flow is: check status of NVM block --- if block is OK, write NV status[], valid[], last key --- if block is corrupted, but in learning procedure, write NV status[], valid[], last key --- if unknown status of NV block or integrity failed, then set prefail Key Plausibility DTCs in addition, if write to NV during learning procedure is ok, send response to C/S request
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_413}
void
void Globals
sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Write - R/W access, triggers for write operation, cleared when request processed. sNvmWczs Flags.u8Exchange - R/W access, always set during learning together with u8Write flag to generate C/S response for evFFBDataExchange by calling WCZ_DataExchangeResponse. sNvmWcz sFlags.bValid - R/W access, flag set when unknown status of NVM block. sNvmWcz sStatus.u8Backup - R access, status byte for each WCZ key, copied to NVM status bytes buffer to write to NVM. sNvmWcz sStatus.u8LastKeyIndex -R access, copied to NVM buffer to write to NVM.d sNvmWcz sStatus.pim_ptr->rb_fdh_Retry - R/W access, restored from NVM, reinit in case of corrupted data.
Input->Output-Correlation
Input: input data and write trigger is available in Globals, NVM block status check via NvM_GetErrorStatus()
Called cyclically from WCZ_CyclicHandle. Requested write operation (by DATA_NVM_STATUS_WR flag set in u8Write byte) from UHF_CyclicHandle via WCZ_SetStatus. Alternatively sporadic request during learning procedure from evFFBDataExchange. Output: NVM block write triggered holding WCZ status information. DTC plausible tested with prefailed status when unknown status of NVM block. During learning procedure response is generated through WCZ_DataExchangeResponse to evFFBDataExchange Activity Diagram WCZ_StatusWriteToNvm
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_StatusWriteToNvm
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_118.
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_413.
Status of all keys is transferred to NVM from internal buffers.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Read back after status block write to NVM.

The simplified flow is: check status of NVM block --- if block is OK, clear read flag --- if block is "pending", do nothing --- if unknown status of NV block or integrity failed, then set prefail Key Plausibility DTCs in addition, if verification of NV write is performed during learning procedure and is ok/nok, send adequate response to WCZ evFFBDataExchange C/S request
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
void
void Globals
sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Write - R/W access, trigger for write (DATA_NVM_STATUS_RD) sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Exchange - R/W access, always set during learning together with u8Write flag to generate C/S response for evFFBDataExchange by calling WCZ_DataExchangeResponse sNvmWcz sFlags.bValid - R/W access, flag cleared when verification process is faulty
Input->Output-Correlation
Input: NVM block status check via NvM_GetErrorStatus(), trigger for verify flag, see Globals
Called from WCZ_CyclicHandle periodically (every 10ms). Requested write operation (by DATA_NVM_STATUS_RD flag set in u8Write byte) from UHF_CyclicHandle via WCZ_SetStatus. Alternatively sporadic request during learning procedure from evFFBDataExchange. Output: updated flags are available in Globals,
During learning procedure response is generated through WCZ_DataExchangeResponse to evFFBDataExchange Activity Diagram WCZ_StatusVerifyNvm
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_StatusVerifyNvm
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_118.
Read back after status block write to NVM.
Please find detail information in the declaration.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8 SlotIndex, const uint8 KeyIndex, const uint32 value, const boolean storeInNvM)
memberdef.name: WCZ_SetValue

detaileddescription.para: Function to store rolling code counter value.

Store WCZ value in internal buffer, under given slot and key index location. There are R/W flags set to perform NVM write and verification. If Flags are set then value will be stored in NVM if not just in RAM.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_520}
uint8
SlotIndex - slot index with valid range 0 or 1, alternatively in use. . [in] uint8 KeyIndex - key index with valid range 1..8. . [in] uint32 value - value to be stored in internal status buffer and written to NVM. [in] boolean storeInNvM - flag which is determine if value have to be stored in NvM or not.
void Globals
sNvmWcz sValue.u32Backup - read and write value, buffer updated on value change. sNvmWcz sValue.u8Write - write value - clear read request just in case it is set. Not needed for requested operation. sNvmWcz sValue.u8Read - write value, triggers NVM W/V operation by flags DATA_NVM_SLOT_WR() / DATA_NVM_SLOT_RD().
Input->Output-Correlation
WCZ storage triggered from UHF_CyclicHandle for new telegram, when detected that it is "first telegram". Second case - during key learning procedure evFFBDataExchange. WCZ Write and verification is processed in cyclic calls from WCZ_CyclicHandle. Activity Diagram WCZ_SetValue
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_SetValue
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_520.
Function to store rolling code counter value.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
WCZ for all keys are transferred from NVM to internal buffers.

In "real", use after wake up or reset, otherwise no effect. The simplified flow is: clear all R/W flags clear WCZ for all keys - for all 3 blocks from requested slot: --- check status of NVM block --- if block is OK, increase counter of "good" blocks --- if block is corrupted, rewrite block with values in internal buffers, which are 0's --- if unknown status of NV block, then set prefail Key Plausibility DTCs if counter of "good" blocks is 3 (all are ok in specific slot) - restore value to internal buffer if 2 out of 3 hold the same value, set Key Plausibility DTCs to prepassed else set internal buffer to 0, set Key Plausibility DTCs to prefailed
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_321} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_323} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_329}
uint8
SlotIndex - 0..1 (i.e. A,B) slots are allowed only.
void Globals
sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Write - R/W access, triggers for write operation, cleared when request processed. sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Read - R/W access, trigger for read. sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Write - W access, unconditional clear. sNvmWcz sFlags.bValid - W access, flag cleared on faults. sNvmWcz sValue[SLOT_INDEX_A/B].u32Backup[] - R/W access, 4 byte WCZ internal buffer is initialized / restored from NVM. sNvmWcz sValue[SLOT_INDEX_A/B].pim_ptr[iwcz]->rb_fdh_WCZ[ikey] - R/W access,NVM RAM mirror, restored from NVM, reinit in case of corrupted data.
Input->Output-Correlation
Input: NVM blocks in requested slot; NVM blocks status check via NvM_GetErrorStatus(), see Globals
Called from WCZ_CyclicHandle periodically (every 10ms). However read from NVM operation is triggered (flag DATA_NVM_SLOT_RD set) only during system wake up initialization WCZ_Initialization. Output: output data is available in Globals,
In case of detected corrupted NVM block (none of 2 same blocks) or invalid state of NVM block, DTCs for all keys (8) "WCZ plausible" is tested as prefail. Id 2 or 3 values out of 3 are same, then DTC is prepassed for each key/DTC. Activity Diagram WCZ_ValueReadFromNvm
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_ValueReadFromNvm

Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:

SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_118.

WCZ for all keys are transferred from NVM to internal buffers.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
WCZ for all keys are transferred to NVM from internal buffers.

The simplified flow is: for all 3 NV blocks from requested slot: --- check status of NVM block --- if block is OK, increase counter of "good" blocks --- if block is corrupted but key learning is ongoing, ignore it --- if block is corrupted or unknown status, then set prefail Key Plausibility DTCs and send "NOK" response to WCZ evFFBDataExchange C/S request (only if in key learning routine) if counter of "good" blocks is 3 (all are ok in specific slot) --- transfer WCZ value from internal buffer to all 3 blocks in specified slot --- clear write flag and send response to WCZ evFFBDataExchange C/S request (only if in key learning routine)
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_322} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_323} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_457}
uint8
SlotIndex - 0..1 (i.e. A,B) slots are allowed only.
void Globals
sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Write - R/W access, triggers for write operation, cleared when request processed. sNvmWcz .sFlags.u8Write - R/W access, NVM write trigger flag, cleared when request processed sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Exchange - always set during learning together with u8Write flag to generate C/S response for evFFBDataExchange by calling WCZ_DataExchangeResponse sNvmWcz sFlags.bValid - W access, flag cleared on faults sNvmWcz sValue[SLOT_INDEX_A/B].u32Backup[] - R access, 4 byte WCZ internal buffer is copied to NVM block RAM mirror area sNvmWcz sValue[SLOT_INDEX_A/B].pim_ptr[iwcz]->rb_fdh_WCZ[ikey] - W access,NVM RAM mirror overwritten before NVM write op is triggered.
Input->Output-Correlation
Input: NVM blocks in requested slot; NVM blocks status check via NvM_GetErrorStatus(), see Globals
Called from WCZ_CyclicHandle periodically (every 10ms). Requested write operation (flag DATA_NVM_SLOT_WR set)- refer to WCZ_SetValue Output: output data in RAM mirror of NVM block In case of invalid state of NVM block, DTCs for all keys (8) "WCZ plausible" is tested as prefail. During learning procedure response is generated through WCZ_DataExchangeResponse to evFFBDataExchange. Activity Diagram WCZ_ValueWriteToNvm
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_ValueWriteToNvm

Please find detail information in the declaration.
Determine status of all NVM blocks in requested slot, which store WCZ for all keys.

The simplified flow is: for all 3 NV blocks from requested slot: --- check status of NVM block --- if block is OK, increase counter of "good" blocks --- if block is corrupted or unknown status, then set prefail Key Plausibility DTCs and send "NOK" response to WCZ evFFBDataExchange C/S request (only if in key learning routine) if counter of "good" blocks is 3 (all are ok in specific slot) - check WCZ data plausibility (compare 3 copies) --- if any 2 copies differ, then set prefail Key Plausibility DTCs --- if 2 or 3 copies of WCZ are same, copy it to internal buffer, then set prepassed Key Plausibility DTCs --- clear read flag - if in key learning process, send "OK" response to WCZ evFFBDataExchange C/S request if R/W flags cleared (i.e. write and verification succesfull); "NOK" otherwise
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint8
SlotIndex - 0..1 (i.e. A,B) slots are allowed only.
void Globals
sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Write - R/W access, verification is triggered sNvmWcz sFlags.bValid - W access, flag cleared on faults sNvmWcz sFlags.u8Exchange - R/W, always set during learning together with u8Write flag to generate C/S response for evFFBDataExchange by calling WCZ_DataExchangeResponse sNvmWcz sNvmWcz.sValue[SLOT_INDEX_A/B].u32Backup[] - W access, 4 byte WCZ internal buffer is restored from NVM sNvmWcz sNvmWcz.sValue[SLOT_INDEX_A/B].pim_ptr[iwcz]->rb_fdh_WCZ[ikey] - R access,NVM RAM mirror, restored from NVM.
Input->Output-Correlation
Input: NVM blocks in requested slot; NVM blocks status check via NvM_GetErrorStatus(), see Globals
Called from WCZ_CyclicHandle periodically (every 10ms). However verify from NVM operation is triggered (flag DATA_NVM_SLOT_RD flag set) together with write operation (verify executed after write "part" is done). Output: output data is available in Globals,
In case of detected corrupted NVM block (none of 2 same blcoks) or invalid state of NVM block, DTCs for all keys (8) "WCZ plausible" is tested as prefail. Id 2 or 3 values out of 3 are same, then DTC is prepassed for each key/DTC.. During learning procedure response is generated through WCZ_DataExchangeResponse to evFFBDataExchange Activity Diagram WCZ_ValueVerifyNvm
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_ValueVerifyNvm

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8 KeyIndex, const boolean bEnable, const uint8 u8WczCode[], uint8 u8Status[], uint32 u32Value[])
memberdef.name: WCZ_DataExchange

detaileddescription.para: Function converting WCZ value received during key learning.

Converts WCZ value received during key learning from byte oriented table to uint32 for specified key index, assuming key is enabled, otherwise WCZ is set to 0. Output status is transferred to key index position in the status table.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_521}
uint8
KeyIndex - key index with valid range 1..8. [in] boolean - bEnable - key is enabled [in] uint8 u8WczCode[] - WCZ in byte oriented form [out] uint8 u8StatusList[] - status out, filled at c-style key position [out] uint32 u32ValueList[] - output u32 WCZ filled to c-style key position
void Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
Internally WCZ is stored as 32 bit uint. Conversion is performed during learning, while storing of initial WCZ. Activity Diagram WCZ_SetupSlot
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_DataExchange
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_521
Function converting WCZ value received during key learning.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Function handles data exchange C/S response communication ( evFFBDataExchangeResp).

Returned statuses are: Pending - data exchange/NVM storage in progress; OK - NVM storage complete and succesfull; ERR - problem encountered during NVM storage attempt.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_522}
boolean
bSaveWCZValid - true, if WCZ for the keys are stored succesfully during learning process [in] uint8 numSaveWCZStatus - when all flags cleared, NVM storage process is completed
void Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
During learning process, when WCZ storage to NVM is performed, response to C/S call evFFBDataExchange is generated, depending on process stage/result OK/ERR/In progress status is responded via evFFBDataExchangeResp interface. Activity Diagram WCZ_DataExchangeResponse
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_WCZ_DataExchangeResponse
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
